Package org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.orchestrators

Class GenericOrchestrator.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.epsci.ersap.std.orchestrators.GenericOrchestrator.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    GenericOrchestrator
    public static class GenericOrchestrator.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Helps constructing a GenericOrchestrator with all default and required parameters.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Builder​(java.lang.String servicesFile, java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputFiles)
      Sets the required arguments for the generic data processing orchestrator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder​(java.lang.String servicesFile,
               java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputFiles)
        Sets the required arguments for the generic data processing orchestrator.
        Parameters:
        servicesFile - the YAML file describing the data processing application
        inputFiles - the list of files to be processed (only names).
        Throws:
        OrchestratorConfigException - in case of any error in the application description

    • Method Detail

      • withFrontEnd

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withFrontEnd​(DpeName frontEnd)
        Sets the name of the front-end. Use this if the orchestrator is not running in the same node as the front-end, or if the orchestrator is not using the proper network interface or port for the front-end.
        Parameters:
        frontEnd - the name of the front-end DPE
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • cloudMode

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder cloudMode()
        Uses a cloud of worker DPEs to process the set of input files. By default, the orchestrator runs on local mode, which only uses the local front-end DPE.
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withSession

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withSession​(java.lang.String session)
        Sets the session used by the DPEs of interest. The orchestrator will connect an use only the DPEs registered with the given session, ignoring all others.
        Parameters:
        session - the session of interest
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • useFrontEnd

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder useFrontEnd()
        Uses the front-end for data processing. By default, the front-end is only used for registration and discovery.
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • useStageDirectory

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder useStageDirectory()
        Stages the input file on the node for local access. By default, all files are expected to be on the input directory.

        When staging is used, the files will be copied on demand from the input directory into the staging directory before using it. The output file will also be saved in the stating directory. When the data processing is finished, it will be moved back to the output directory.

        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained
        See Also:
        withStageDirectory(String)

      • withPoolSize

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withPoolSize​(int poolSize)
        Sets the size of the thread-pool that will process reports from services and nodes.
        Parameters:
        poolSize - the pool size for the orchestrator
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withMaxThreads

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withMaxThreads​(int maxThreads)
        Sets the maximum number of threads to be used for data processing on every node.
        Parameters:
        maxThreads - how many parallel threads should be used on the DPEs
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withMaxNodes

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withMaxNodes​(int maxNodes)
        Sets the maximum number of nodes to be used for data processing.
        Parameters:
        maxNodes - how many worker nodes should be used to process input files
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withReportFrequency

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withReportFrequency​(int frequency)
        Sets the frequency of the "done" event reports.
        Parameters:
        frequency - the frequency of done reports
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withSkipEvents

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withSkipEvents​(int skip)
        Sets the number of events to skip.
        Parameters:
        skip - how many events to skip
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withMaxEvents

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withMaxEvents​(int max)
        Sets the maximum number of events to read.
        Parameters:
        max - how many events to process
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withInputDirectory

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withInputDirectory​(java.lang.String inputDir)
        Changes the path of the shared input directory. This directory should contain all input files.
        Parameters:
        inputDir - the input directory
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withOutputDirectory

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withOutputDirectory​(java.lang.String outputDir)
        Changes the path of the shared output directory. This directory will contain all output files.
        Parameters:
        outputDir - the output directory
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withOutputFilePrefix

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withOutputFilePrefix​(java.lang.String outputFilePrefix)
        Changes output file prefix.
        Parameters:
        outputFilePrefix - the output file prefix
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • withStageDirectory

        public GenericOrchestrator.Builder withStageDirectory​(java.lang.String stageDir)
        Changes the path of the local staging directory. Files will be staged in this directory of every worker node for fast access.
        Parameters:
        stageDir - the local staging directory
        Returns:
        this object, so methods can be chained

      • build

        public GenericOrchestrator build()
        Creates the orchestrator.
        Returns:
        a new orchestrator object configured as requested
